slides.title: Introduction to Tables
slides.content:
# HTML Tables üìä

HTML tables allow web developers to arrange data into **rows** and **columns**.

## Used For:
- Financial data
- Schedules
- Comparison charts
- Analytics reports

> ‚ö†Ô∏è **Warning:** Do NOT use tables for page layout! Use CSS Flexbox or Grid instead.

slides.title: Basic Table Structure
slides.content:
# Basic Structure üèóÔ∏è A table is defined by ``. - `` defines a **table row**. - `

Row 1, Cell 1 Row 1, Cell 2

slides.title: Table Headers
slides.content:
# Table Headers üé© Use `` for table header cells. - Text in `` elements are **bold** and **centered** by default. ```html
Firstname Lastname Age
Jill Smith 50
Eve Jackson 94
```

slides.title: Adding Captions
slides.content:
# Table Caption üè∑Ô∏è To add a caption to a table, use the `` tag. - The `` tag must be inserted **immediately after** the `` tag. ```html

slides.title: Colspan
slides.content:
# Colspan ‚ÜîÔ∏è To make a cell span more than one column, use the `colspan` attribute. ```html
Name Telephone
Bill Gates 55577854 55577855
``` Here, the "Telephone" header spans two columns.

slides.title: Rowspan
slides.content:
# Rowspan ‚ÜïÔ∏è To make a cell span more than one row, use the `rowspan` attribute. ```html
Name Bill Gates
Phone 55577854
55577855
``` Here, the "Phone" header spans two rows.

slides.title: Colgroup
slides.content:
# Element üèÅ The `` element specifies a group of one or more columns in a table for formatting. Useful for applying styles to entire columns, instead of repeating styles for each cell. ```html
ISBN Title Price
```

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: HTML Tables üéì

Tables are powerful for data presentation.

- **Tags:** `<table>`, `<tr>`, `<th>`, `<td>`
- **Grouping:** `<thead>`, `<tbody>`, `<tfoot>`
- **Merging:** `colspan`, `rowspan`
- **Access:** `<caption>` for description
